title: Ticket #4466: Starter Suggestions
description:
Our MATLAB bin directory is mounted on the exec nodes as a read-only filesystem. When a MATLAB job dumps core, the condor_starter tries to rename the /cluster/MATLAB/R2008b/bin/core file to core.1234567.0 - the associated cluster/process ID - under the UID of the job owner. I assume it's looking in the bin directory because that's where the executable or the working directory is set.

However, the core file would never be created since that directory is read-only, and so the rename() attempt wasn't necessary in the first place. Also, I have adjusted my core pattern so that core dumps are centrally stored and managed, so there wouldn't have been a file simply named "core" even if the directory were writable, and some sites here prevent creation of core dumps entirely by setting a zero size limit in /etc/security/limits.d.

I've tweaked my audit rules to filter these events, but you may wish to have the starter do a stat() and/or a permissions check before it assumes the uid of the job submitter and tries to rename a file which may or may not exist.
